EVSpace 1.3.0
  • Reference

    Event Vector Space

    event.vector.space is an R6 class object that represents relations among the duration of events. Moving from one event to another creates a vector space consisting of relative ordering among start, end, overlap, and span:

    $$ \vec{e} := \begin{bmatrix} E_{0,s} & E_{0,e} \\ E_{1,s} & E_{1,e} \end{bmatrix} $$

    ΔS, ΔE Difference of start and end boundaries: E1, i − E0, i
    Γ The degree of temporal intersection: E1, s − E0, e
    β The maximal time spanned: E1, e − E0, s
    ||V|| Duration of the from and to events: Ei, e − Ei, s
    τ The difference in duration for each event pair: ||V1|| − ||V0||

    ϵ⃗ is a vector in the complex plane describing the relationship (not coordinates) between events.

    It is defined and interpreted as follows:

    $$ \sqrt{ tan^{-1}{\frac{\Delta E}{\Delta S}} * tan^{-1}{\frac{\Gamma \beta}{\Gamma}} } + \Gamma^{\frac{\tau}{2}} $$
    x îy Interpretation
     ≠ 0  = 0 Disjoint
     = 0  ≠ 0 Concurrency
    $\ne 0\enspace \wedge=1$

    $=0\enspace \text{iff } x = 1$

    $\ne 0\enspace\text{iff }x\ne 0$

    		 Full Concurrency
     = 0  = 0 Continuity
